definition: to return/to go back/to come back
to circle/to go back/to turn around/to answer/to return/to revolve/Hui ethnic group (Chinese Muslims)/time/classifier for acts of a play/section or chapter (of a classic book)

sentences.english: Evening return to Kota Kinabalu hotel.
sentences.chinese: 傍晚回返亚庇市酒店休息。

sentences.english: Forgiveness is the return of the mind to the awareness of God.
sentences.chinese: 宽恕是心灵回返认识上主。

sentences.english: Reach back for the joy and the sorrow.
sentences.chinese: 为那些快乐和忧伤回返。

sentences.english: Its mid-rise tilts to hit slightly higher in back.
sentences.chinese: 倾斜上升有一点更高回返。

sentences.english: After breakfast back to Lumut Jetty by ferry.
sentences.chinese: 早餐后乘客船回返红土坎码头。

sentences.english: Transfer to airport for your flight back to Brunei.
sentences.chinese: 送往机场，乘搭新航客机回返汶莱。

sentences.english: The gas piston has its own return spring.
sentences.chinese: 瓦斯活塞有它自己的回返春天。

sentences.english: No matter how high I climb, She guides me safely back to earth.
sentences.chinese: 无论我攀登得多高，总能护我平安回返。

sentences.english: After dinner, he immediately returned to his work position.
sentences.chinese: 吃完饭后，他立刻就回返到工作岗位上。

sentences.english: They are soon forgotten and never return.
sentences.chinese: 他们很快便被遗忘，也永远不再回返。

definition: to go on a journey/to leave
to report on completion of a mission/debriefing
to set out (of troops)/departure/start date (of military expedition)
to set out on a journey
to turn back/to retrace one's steps
to travel at double speed/to make all haste
